nl.tudelft.simulation.dsol.experiment

Class Replication<A extends java.lang.Comparable<A>,R extends java.lang.Number & java.lang.Comparable<R>,T extends SimTime<A,R,T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tudelft.simulation.dsol.experiment.Replication<A,R,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    A - the absolute storage type for the simulation time, e.g. Calendar, Duration, or Double.
    R - the relative type for time storage, e.g. Long for the Calendar. For most non-calendar types, the absolute and relative types are the same.
    T - the extended type itself to be able to implement a comparator on the simulation time.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Replication.CalendarDouble, Replication.CalendarFloat, Replication.CalendarLong, Replication.TimeDouble, Replication.TimeDoubleUnit, Replication.TimeFloat, Replication.TimeFloatUnit, Replication.TimeLong

    public class Replication<A extends java.lang.Comparable<A>,R extends java.lang.Number & java.lang.Comparable<R>,T extends SimTime<A,R,T>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The replication of a runcontrol.

    (c) 2002-2018 Delft University of Technology , the Netherlands.
    See for project information www.simulation.tudelft.nl
    License of use: Lesser General Public License (LGPL) , no warranty.

    Since:
    1.5
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.2 $ $Date: 2010/08/10 11:36:44 $
    Author:
    Peter Jacobs
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Replication

        public Replication(Experiment<A,R,T> experiment)
            throws javax.naming.NamingException
        constructs a new Replication.
        Parameters:
        experiment - the experiment to which this replication belongs
        Throws:
        javax.naming.NamingException - in case a context for the replication cannot be created

      • Replication

        public Replication(java.lang.String id,
                   T startTime,
                   R warmupPeriod,
                   R runLength,
                   DSOLModel<A,R,T> model)
            throws javax.naming.NamingException
        constructs a stand-alone Replication and make a treatment and experiment as well.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the replication.
        startTime - the start time as a time object.
        warmupPeriod - the warmup period, included in the runlength (!)
        runLength - the total length of the run, including the warm-up period.
        model - the model for which this is the replication
        Throws:
        javax.naming.NamingException - in case a context for the replication cannot be created
